name: Cleenseau - Session 25
descTitle: Houille, Peydon, and Plans Against Malach
tagline: in which the party learns the truth about the king and takes up a phylactery quest
shortSummary: Near Houille and Peydon, the Heroes of Cleenseau meet Raoul, learn that King Robert I has been a lich named Malach for four years, and agree to retrieve one fragment of his phylactery while dodging the Baronessâ€™s summons.
longSummary: After quietly leaving Peydon and avoiding the Baroness's messenger, Robin, Viepuck, Celyn, and Izgil hike into the hills to meet Raoul, a terrifyingly powerful cleric of the Night Queen, accompanied by his bodyguards Julien Marteau and Sveta Dragunov. Inside Raoul's scry-blocking Tiny Temple, they learn that King Robert I has been dead for four years and replaced by a lich named Malach, whose continent-spanning magic fuels undead waves and eavesdrops on any mention of his name. Raoul and the higher-level party plan to hunt two fragments of Malach's divided phylactery and commission the Heroes of Cleenseau to secure the third fragment believed to be in Aveil; Izgil locates which fragment lies where via divination, and the party agrees to recover it and contact Raoul. On the road, Viepuck becomes a magical telegraph using Sending, coordinating with allies in the Western Army and others, trolling the Baroness via the Sending locket, and seeding Night Queen PR in Peydon, while Izgil obsessively experiments with his rings. The group ultimately chooses a route toward the Greenwood the Great and other targets rather than walking straight into the Baroness's grasp at Veltor.
